author: Matthew Panter
title: Exciting year ahead as Shropshire firm expands after completing takeover
text:
Exciting year ahead as Shropshire firm expands after completing takeover
Driver training specialist Dulson Training has expanded its operation with the acquisition of Cheshire-based DDay Training.
Dulson Training already has existing sites in Shrewsbury, Telford, Wrexham, Ludlow and a satellite centre in Wolverhampton.
The addition of the new site near Nantwich will see the firm serving customers throughout North West England, the West Midlands and Wales.
The takeover sees Dulson Training acquire the premises, equipment and staff at DDay Training in a smooth transition that follows the two companies working together on numerous training projects for more than a decade.
Nine new vehicles and trailers have been added to the Dulson Training fleet, making it one of the largest providers in the UK but Steve Dulson, Dulson Training MD, said the size of the operation will not take anything away from the quality of the training delivered, with each site being managed for the results everyone expects from a family operated business.
Mr Dulson said: ‚ÄúWe have already had some great news and exciting projects being rolled out for 2024 but the addition of DDay and its services in Cheshire probably excites me the most.
‚ÄúI know that this new location will really strengthen our reach into the North West. This is an area where we have already seen significant growth since opening our Wrexham training site a few years ago.
‚ÄúI have known Tim and Dawn at DDay for years, we have co-delivered some training and helped each other when either party has had an issue, such as covering some training or the loan of equipment. The relationship has always been strong and I have admired how they have built their family business into what it is today.
‚ÄúThis is something I understand really well, after putting the same effort into Dulson Training since 2013 - making sure customer service and experience remains our main focus. Aligning with DDay seemed a perfect fit and the last few months have transitioned really well.
‚ÄúThe instructors and administrative staff at DDay will now become part of the Dulson team and that's something I am excited about. It's great to have new people starting who we already have a history with.
‚ÄúWe will make subtle changes to the operation over the coming years and look to expand on some of the course options but the ethos of DDay will not change. It will align with Dulson Training's own aim to provide the best customer service and training without compromise.‚Äù
Tim Day, of DDay Training, said: ‚ÄúMy wife Dawn and I started DDay Training over a decade ago, building up a really strong foundation by delivering the highest level of Driver CPC, ADR and Licence Acquisition lorry and bus training throughout Cheshire and North Wales.
‚ÄúWe have become known for our excellent customer service and our reputation has helped us to grow and create stability as a highly respected training provider for the logistics industry. As the time has approached to hand over the reins, we wanted to make sure that whoever stepped in had the passion to continue the service and training that we are known for.
‚ÄúThat was an easy choice with Dulson Training. Over the years they have worked with us on assignments and have proved over and over again that they operate in the same way. A passion for every learner to succeed.
‚ÄúOver recent months a smooth transition has taken place and as we head into 2024 a seamless change of hands has happened without any quality and output being changed. I know that with Steve and his team, DDay Training is in great hands.‚Äù
Mr Dulson added: ‚ÄúWith some exciting contracts in hand and a busy schedule already planned for 2024, Dulson Training looks forward to operating in a new area and continuing to build upon the foundation that DDay Training has already built. The Dulson and DDay name and service will now align for 2024 and beyond and our Cheshire and North West presence will increase significantly.
‚ÄúOur services include lorry and bus licence acquisition and driver assessments, Driver CPC, Forklift, First Aid, ADR, Fleet Training across all regions and we will have some more exciting news to announce soon.‚Äù

author: Redacci√≥n de La Naci√≥n
title: Cinco miembros de banda Los Lara reciben severas penas por homicidios | La Naci√≥n
text: Cinco miembros del grupo narcotraficante Los Lara fueron condenados a largas penas en prisi√≥n por cinco homicidios cometidos en el 2020. Por seguridad, la sentencia fue dictada este jueves por la tarde en una sala de los Tribunales de Justicia de San Jos√©, sin embargo, la causa fue juzgada por por el Tribunal Penal del Tercer Circuito Judicial, albergado en Pavas. Jos√© Jair Mungu√≠a Campos, de apenas 22 a√±os, fue sentenciado a 105 a√±os en la c√°rcel por los asesinatos de Jordan Steven L√≥pez Segura, de 22 a√±os, Esteban Andr√©s Garc√≠a Hidalgo, de 23 a√±os y Jos√© Pablo Cajina Bola√±os, de 26 a√±os. Seg√∫n lo acreditado en el debate, los tres estaban en un bar de barrio La California el 20 de febrero del 2020 . Al sitio lleg√≥ Mungu√≠a, en compa√±√≠a de otros sujetos y persuadi√≥ a las v√≠ctimas para desplazarse a un sitio en Hatillo, donde los ofendidos fueron retenidos y atacados a golpes. Luego, los llevaron hasta Alajuelita, donde los ultimaron a balazos. L√≥pez y Garc√≠a murieron en el sitio con una herida en la cabeza cada uno, y sus cuerpos quedaron tendidos sobre la carretera al lado de un veh√≠culo. Cajina huy√≥ del sitio, pero ya hab√≠a recibido impactos de bala por lo que fue trasladado al Hospital San Juan de Dios, donde muri√≥ tres d√≠as despu√©s. Jean Paul Vargas Brenes, de 25 a√±os, tambi√©n descontar√° 30 a√±os en prisi√≥n por el homicidio de Jorge Alberto Morales Molina , de 34 a√±os, el 19 de noviembre del 2020 en Hatillo 8 de San Jos√©. Morales tuvo disputas con Los Lara, por lo que llegaron a buscarlo a su casa y le dispararon varias veces. Por √∫ltimo, Kevin Barr Arburola (29), Yilmar N√∫√±ez Rodr√≠guez y Jean Paul Salas Castro pasar√°n 35 a√±os en prisi√≥n por la muerte de Malckon Guti√©rrez Harley, de 26 a√±os, quien fue atado de manos y vapuleado en su casa, en la ciudadela 25 de Julio, en Hatillo, el 18 de marzo del 2020. Los ahora condenados lo trasladaron hasta las cercan√≠as del t√∫nel Zurqu√≠, en la ruta 32, donde lo asesinaron de 16 balazos. Adem√°s, incendiaron su autom√≥vil. LEA M√ÅS: Homicidas acribillan a balazos a joven de 26 a√±os y lo dejan maniatado al lado de carro en llamas A todos se les impuso un a√±o adicional de c√°rcel por asociaci√≥n il√≠cita. En los casos en los que corresponda, se les dictaron seis meses de prisi√≥n preventiva, mientras la sentencia adquiere firmeza. Aunque Mungu√≠a recibi√≥ una condena total de 106 a√±os, purgar√° un m√°ximo de 50 a√±os, que es el plazo m√°ximo en prisi√≥n estipulado por la legislaci√≥n costarricense. Cuatro de los sentenciados decidieron salir de la sala antes de que los jueces razonaran los castigos impuestos. En las afueras de la Sala un se√±ora adulta lloraba desconsolada, mientras dec√≠a: ‚ÄúSe√±or t√∫ sabes que no hizo nada‚Äù.

author: Sacred Heart
title: Holiday Gift Guide: Sacred Heart University 2024 Edition | Sacred Heart University
text:
For the Cultural Connoisseur: An Opportunity to Be Entertained
Every year brings a new slate of entertaining and thought-provoking events to the [SHU Community Theatre](https://www.shucommunitytheatre.org/) in downtown Fairfield. Film screenings, discussions and live performances featuring some of the biggest names in entertainment inspire and educate SHU audiences and area visitors throughout the year. Why not consider [purchasing a gift card](https://www.shucommunitytheatre.org/gift-certificates) or learning about a [gift membership](https://www.shucommunitytheatre.org/become-a-member)? Or pick up the tab on an upcoming theatrical, musical or dance performance at the [John & Sabina Petillo Center for the Performing Arts](//www.sacredheart.edu/sacred-heart-life/student-events--activities/performing-arts-program/john-and-sabina-petillo-center-for-the-performing-arts/) or the [Edgerton Center for the Performing Arts](https://edgertoncenter.org/), such as [A Christmas Carol](https://edgertoncenter.org/events/a-christmas-carol-2/)‚Äîan adaptation written by nationally recognized alumni playwright Grace Caroline Curley, ‚Äò23, and starring SHU alum John Ratzenberger as Scrooge. You could also consider [a gift subscription](https://edgertoncenter.org/ticket-information/be-a-subscriber/). Along those lines, why not gift a ‚Äútrip‚Äù to space through Sacred Heart University‚Äôs [Discovery Science Center & Planetarium](https://www.shudiscovery.org/)?

author: Paz Henr√≠quez
title: La ciudad chilena a menos de tres horas de Punta Arenas que cautiva con sus paisajes y avistamiento de glaciares
text:
El sur de Chile sorprende constantemente por sus imponentes paisajes que incluyen r√≠os, lagos, cordillera, [playas](https://www.rockandpop.cl/2024/12/la-ciudad-chilena-a-2-horas-de-osorno-que-sorprende-a-todos-por-sus-playas-y-senderos/), valles, e incluso glaciares. De hecho, una ciudad chilena a menos de tres horas de Punta Arenas se ha convertido en uno de los destinos preferidos de turistas extranjeros.
A 247 kil√≥metros de Punta Arenas se encuentra la ciudad de Puerto Natales, que sorprende con playas, lagos, r√≠os, fiordos y el Parque Nacional Torres del Paine. Este √∫ltimo cuenta con varios recorridos a glaciares y sectores monta√±osos, considerados como la octava maravilla del mundo.
Cabe destacar que para conocer la mayor√≠a de las atracciones del Parque Nacional Torres del Paine, se deben realizar trekkings de bastantes kil√≥metros, por lo que hay que tener cierta preparaci√≥n.
Pero el parque nacional no es la √∫nica atracci√≥n de la zona austral chilena, pues en la ciudad de Puerto Natales hay varias opciones para disfrutar.
¬øQu√© actividades se pueden realizar en Puerto Natales?
Conocida como una de las ciudades m√°s australes del planeta, Puerto Natales se convierte en un destino ideal para visitar durante las vacaciones.
Uno de sus grandes atractivos, es por supuesto su hist√≥rico muelle, pues a trav√©s de el se puede divisar el Oc√©ano Pac√≠fico. Por otra parte, dentro de sus paisajes destacan fiordos y glaciares, que se pueden visitar en paquetes full day, sin la necesidad de hacer senderismo.
Por otra parte, otro lugar que es una parada obligatoria es la Cueva del Milod√≥n, un monumento natural a 25 kil√≥metros de Puerto Natales. En dicho [espacio](https://www.conaf.cl/parque_nacionales/monumento-natural-cueva-del-milodon/), se ubica un accidente natural en donde se encontraron restos del milod√≥n, animal extinto perteneciente a la familia de los mam√≠feros, que mantiene similitudes con los perezosos.
Finalmente, el sector cuenta con una amplia oferta gastron√≥mica, en donde se encuentran desde cervezas artesanales hasta platos t√≠picos.

author: Jeremiah Budin
title: Scientists make major leap that could prevent catastrophic failures in fusion reactors ‚Äî here's how it could unlock the secret to limitless energy
text:
If scientists can get nuclear fusion reactors to work, it could unlock the secret to providing our society with unlimited clean, renewable energy. Although researchers aren't there yet, they have just gotten one step closer by developing a potential way to keep super-hot plasma separate from the energy-generating coolant inside a fusion reactor, Popular Mechanics reported .
Although nuclear power plants already exist, they operate using nuclear fission ‚Äî the nuclear reaction where atoms are split apart. Nuclear fusion, on the other hand, occurs when two atoms slam together, mimicking the same process that powers the sun.
If scientists can harness that power, it could provide virtually unlimited energy (without the same radioactive byproducts that come from nuclear fission), which is why some have dubbed it the future of clean energy.
üó£Ô∏è Should we be pouring money into nuclear fusion technology? üîò Yes ‚Äî it'll pay off üëç üîò It's worth exploring üî¨ üîò Not from our tax dollars üí∞ üîò No ‚Äî it's a waste üëé üó≥Ô∏è Click your choice to see results and speak your mind One of the hurdles scientists must first clear to harness that power is building tokamaks ‚Äî torus-shaped devices that can contain nuclear fusion reactions ‚Äî which can withstand the incredibly hot plasma roiling around inside.
Now, MIT researchers believe they may have found the solution. In a study published in the journal Acta Materialia, senior author Ju Li laid out a method for drawing away problematic helium atoms that could wreak havoc on the inner walls of the tokamak ‚Äî by dispersing iron silicate into the bulk metal.
"We want to disperse the ceramic phase uniformly in the bulk metal to ensure that all grain boundary regions are close to the dispersed ceramic phase, so it can provide protection to those regions," Li said in a press statement. "The two phases need to coexist, so the ceramic won't either clump together or totally dissolve in the iron."
Watch now: Would you wear a shirt made out of oysters? If that all sounds a bit dense and science-y, the good news is that this breakthrough could bring us one step closer to an energy source that could be scaled up to provide all the power we need, without releasing tons of planet-overheating air pollution like our current primary energy sources: gas and oil.
In other recent good nuclear fusion-related news, a Tokyo-based company just launched a pilot nuclear fusion reactor, and a San Francisco company recently developed a process for refining one of the rare elements necessary to keep the plants running.
Join our free newsletter for weekly updates on the latest innovations improving our lives and shaping our future , and don't miss this cool list of easy ways to help yourself while helping the planet.

author: Tim Heitman
title: Anthony Davis of the Dallas Mavericks leaves the court with an adductor muscle injury during an NBA game against the Houston Rockets | National | bigcountrynewsconnection.com
text:
[]
Anthony Davis of the Dallas Mavericks leaves the court with an adductor muscle injury during an NBA game against the Houston Rockets
- Tim Heitman

Anthony Davis, the star forward who landed in Dallas in the shock trade that sent Luka Doncic to the Los Angeles Lakers, will miss at least two more weeks with an adductor muscle strain, the Mavericks said Thursday.

author: AFP
title: Vietnam marks 70th anniversary of Dien Bien Phu victory over France
text:
War veterans, soldiers and dignitaries will gather for the 70th anniversary of the Battle of Dien Bien Phu in Vietnam, which ultimately led to the end of the French empire in Indochina / ¬© AFP
War veterans, soldiers and dignitaries will gather in Vietnam's Dien Bien Phu on Tuesday to mark the 70th anniversary of the battle that ultimately brought to an end the French empire in Indochina.
Vietnam has invited for the first time a government minister from the former colonial power to attend official celebrations, which will involve 12,000 people, a gun salute and howitzer and helicopter displays.
French Defence Minister Sebastien Lecornu and Vietnam's Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh will be among those attending the two-hour event that has drawn huge attention from tourists and residents of northwestern Dien Bien province, which borders Laos.
"I think it's good the Vietnamese government had invited the French defence minister to attend," army major Ha Thi Duong told AFP after paying her first visit to the former French command bunker in the city centre.
"The past is gone. We no longer think of conflict or hatred. It's good to shake hands as we all want more friends and less enemies," Duong said.
- 'Deaths were normal' -
French Defence Minister Sebastien Lecornu examines a map of the Battle of Dien Bien Phu in Vietnam ahead of commemorations for the battle's 70th anniversary / ¬© AFP
France surrendered to Viet Minh attacks on May 7, 1954, putting an end to 56 days of shelling and hand-to-hand combat.
Around 13,000 people were reported dead or missing during the conflict, including 10,000 from the Viet Minh side.
"I fired a shot which hit two people, killing one on the spot and the other one with one more shot," recalled veteran infantry soldier Hoang Van Bay, 93.
"Injuries and deaths were normal in the battlefield, nothing to be scared of. We fought for our independence and freedom," Bay told AFP, adding he visited his fallen comrades at Dien Bien Phu city's cemetery every year.
The French expeditionary force -- with some 15,000 men of many nationalities -- had underestimated the firepower of the communist forces, who managed to install cannon on the hills overlooking the French camp.
The Viet Minh had transported them in pieces hundreds of kilometres through the jungle, sometimes by bicycle.
Their victory later led to the Geneva Accords on July 21, 1954, which marked the end of almost a century of French domination in Indochina and the partition of Vietnam, a prelude to future American involvement.
Relations between the two former enemies are now cordial, despite the human rights abuses of which the communist government is regularly accused.
- 'More openness' -
The tree-lined streets of Dien Bien Phu were adorned with communist slogans and banners carrying photos of independence hero Ho Chi Minh and General Vo Nguyen Giap, commander in chief of the Dien Bien Phu campaign, ahead of the celebrations.
Visitors walk across a hill lined with trenches before commemorations for the 70th anniversary of the Battle of Dien Bien Phu in Vietnam / ¬© AFP
The city was busy with crowds of tourists and a heavy military and police presence.
The province's battle sites are also undergoing a major facelift, with the Vietnamese authorities keen to turn the area into a tourism hotspot.
"Twenty years ago, it (the commemoration) was much more discreet. There was a sort of holding back on the Vietnamese side because May 7 is sacred for them," said Pierre Journoud, professor of contemporary history at Paul Valery-Montpellier University, who is attending the commemorations.
"We are seeing more openness today."
He said Vietnam's invitation to Lecornu reflects shared political interests, as tensions simmer between Hanoi and Beijing over their competing territorial claims in the South China Sea.
After the United States and China, "France wants to be a third voice in the Asia-Pacific region, and this is in line with the position of Vietnam, which is caught between two strangleholds," he said.
Prime Minister Chinh said on Monday the visit was an effort to "close the past, overcome differences and head towards the future", in order to promote a strategic relationship between Vietnam and France.
French veterans Jean-Yves Guinard, Andre Mayer and William Schilardi return to visit the site of the Battle of Dien Bien Phu in Vietnam ahead of 70th anniversary commemorations / ¬© AFP
Ninety-two-year-old Jean-Yves Guinard, one of three French veterans who returned to their former camp for the anniversary, told AFP he "remained very attached to this country".
The three were surrounded as they arrived at the Dien Bien Phu Victory Museum by locals and tourists trying to take selfies with the former "enemy".

author: CNN Newsource
title: Safety concerns rise after 3 generations in one family killed in Johnson County crash - Local News 8
text:
By OLIVIA LEACH
Click here for updates on this story
 GLEN ROSE, Texas ( KTVT ) ‚Äî People in parts of North Texas are expressing concerns for their safety, after a deadly wreck on a busy highway this week.
That crash happened Tuesday afternoon in Johnson County when a pickup truck and minivan collided head-on near County Road 1119 and U.S. Highway 67. Six people died and three others were seriously hurt. Five of the six killed were members of the same family.
‚ÄúReally it‚Äôs a dangerous highway a lot of accidents been happening lately and it‚Äôs a busy highway so I feel like something needs to be done,‚Äù said Patricia Simmons the owner of the Big Cup Eatery in Glen Rose.
Simmons‚Äô restaurant is about 10 miles away from the scene of the crash. She‚Äôs lived in Glen Rose for over 20 years and often worries about getting into a wreck when she drives down highway 67.
‚ÄúSomething needs to change, for us, every time that me or my husband go to Cleburne I‚Äôm always worried, a lot of 18 wheelers and people driving too fast,‚Äù said Simmons.
Residents who use this road daily say more needs to be done to prevent serious crashes like this.
‚ÄúWe need more police on that highway because always it‚Äôs been a problem, highway 67,‚Äù said Simmons.
